title: Add a toc to each std lib generated pages

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-dev-tools
labels.description: Relevant to the dev-tools subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Long pages such as in [regex](http://doc.rust-lang.org/regex/regex/index.html) have many examples but it's difficult to know at a glance what the documentation contains without scanning the entire document. Having a table of contents would help a lot with this.

Here is a list of links to different TOC styles from various places for ways it could be done:
- [Python 2.7](https://docs.python.org/2/tutorial/introduction.html) has one in the sidebar. Stays with you as you scroll.
- [Python 3.5](https://docs.python.org/3.5/tutorial/introduction.html) seems to be slightly cleaner but similar. Doesn't stay with you.
- [mozilla javascript docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide/Functions): is nicely in the sidebar. Follows you down the page (requires the window to be wide enough).
- [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cat): in the middle of the page. Doesn't scroll with you. 
- [gitbook](http://rustbyexample.com/): stays with you. provides scrolling.
- [perl](http://perldoc.perl.org/perl.html): looks like it's formatted like a man page.

I looked for some more but didn't find other good examples.

Of these, I like the mozilla, python 2, and gitbook TOCs best with the mozilla probably the best among them (probably because it's small and clean). However, I think the gitbook style is probably the most appropriate fit to the std libs style.

I've also provided a mockups of what a TOC could look like in that style which is similar to a [different thread](https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/rustdoc-mockup-for-including-more-structured-content/2540). Clearly, something would need to be done with the current sidebar to use this format.
